verses.roman:
niśā-mukhaṁ mānayantāv
uditoḍupa-tārakam
mallikā-gandha-mattāli-
juṣṭaṁ kumuda-vāyunā

synonyms: niśā-mukham—the beginning of night; mānayantau—the two of Them honoring; udita—having risen; uḍupa—the moon; tārakam—and stars; mallikā—of the jasmine flowers; gandha—by the fragrance; matta—intoxicated; ali—by the bees; juṣṭam—liked; kumuda—from the lotuses; vāyunā—with the breeze.
translation: The two Lords praised the nightfall, signaled by the rising of the moon and the appearance of stars, a lotus-scented breeze and bees intoxicated by the fragrance of jasmine flowers.
